negotiator

Class Bid

  • java.lang.Object
    • negotiator.Bid
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, XMLable

    public class Bid
extends java.lang.Object
implements XMLable, java.io.Serializable
    A bid is a set of pairs, where idnumber is the unique number of the issue, and value is the picked alternative.

    Bid is a immutable. But you can create modified copies using putValue(int, Value). Bid should be considered final so do not extend this.

    Author:
    Dmytro Tykhonov & Koen Hindriks
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • Bid

        public Bid(Domain domain)

      • Bid

        public Bid(Domain domainP,
   java.util.HashMap<java.lang.Integer,Value> bidP)
        createFrom a new bid in a domain. Partially checks the validity of the bid as well There is only this constructor because we require that ALL values in the domain get assigned a value.
        Parameters:
        domainP - the domain in which the bid is done
        bidP - HashMap, which is a set of pairs
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the bid is not a legal bid in the domain.

      • Bid

        public Bid(Bid bid)
        This method clones the given bid.

        Returns:

        Throws:

      • putValue

        public Bid putValue(int issueId,
           Value pValue)
        Make a new Bid as the current bid but with the value of the issue with the given issueID to the given value.
        Parameters:
        issueId - unique ID of an issue.
        pValue - value of the issue.
